Reviews.Content: Fantastic customer service Couldn't have been happier with our stay at this hotel. What stood out most was the fantastic service that the hotel staff gave us. The staff were very friendly and nothing was too much of a problem for them, particularly in booking a tour for us to Siena and Chianti (which i also recommend doing). The decor in the room was fantastic and the room was well kept.The hotel was maybe a bit too far out of town but we found that the 23 bus was very regular and there is a tabbacheri outside the hotel to buy bus tickets, the ride was about 15 mins.Strongly recommend staying here.
Reviews.Author: AndyMC31

Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Rosary Garden. The breakfast was delicious--they even made cappuccino for us. The personnel were friendly and helpful. We stayed in the top floor room--very spacious. Toilet and shower were in one bathroom, sink and another shower in separate bathroom. We thought it a great place to stay. Our only downer was we took a while to figure out some of the bus stops to get there so wasted some time doing that. Once we figured it out, it was fine. The restaurant below the hotel was also good.
Reviews.Author: Vega07

Reviews.Content: Superb!!!! My wife, three children (2 teenage boys and pre-teen daughter )and I reserved 2 beautiful rooms at the Hotel Rosary Garden. (the rooms are even nicer than the pictures)The beauty, cleanliness and convenience was only out done by the professionalism of the staff and owner. A very short and convenient bus ride from Florence center, staying at the Hotel Rosary Garden gave you the feeling of being a local. We ate at one of the suggested resturants a short drive from the hotel and experienced a memorable evening. If you are searching for a locale that you will rave about upon your return home... look no futher. Book this Hotel now!
Reviews.Author: gogsdad

Reviews.Content: Your Italian home away from home I couldn't agree more with what's been previously written. I just got back from a great stay at this charming hotel. Monica, Alessandro  Andrea make a wonderful team.Although it's not centrally located, the bus ride is really short and gives you a chance to get a bit of the fiorentine feeling.The only thing I would advice against the hotel is the room we stayed in, number 34. It's at the top of the building and, although big in size, it lacks windows. It only has two small skylights, one in the bedroom and the other one in the seating area, making it too dark. Our friends stayed in a room overlooking the piazzetta and it was quite big and definitely much brighter.One last thing to add is that if you have a car they do have a few parking spaces in a nearby lot half a block away.
Reviews.Author: gauchoweho

Reviews.Content: The Rosary is highly recommended We always check TripAdvisor before booking our hotels and all the reviews sounded good. Our experience was a very good one and we can only agree with whats been written by others. Monica made us feel very welcome, she was very helpful and happy to have a conversation in perfect English. The room was nice, clean, well appointed and unusually the decoration included a frieze. Breakfast was fine, though served in a small breakfast room. As long as you don't mind a bus ride into town (some 10-15mins) then this is a great hotel to stay at. We often found ourselves finishing the night with some ice cream from the shop next door - which was excellent. The resturant seemed very popular while we were there and though we only had one meal there it did seem to be better value than some of those over priced resturants in town. I believe that Monica is the owner of this hotel having previously been manager at other hotels. She clearly understands how hotels should be presented, run and how customer service is delivered.
Reviews.Author: juliejoy

Reviews.Content: An Absolute Gem This hotel with its wonderful staff is a great place to stay if you don,t mind a 20 minute bus journey or a 40 minute beautiful walk into the centre of Florence( which, by the way, we didn,t mind). The hotel is situated on a busy square in the day time, regular local buses conveniently just across the street that run from early morning to late night so no problem getting into and from the centre of Florence. There are numerous cafe's and a fantastic Ice cream shop within 2 mins walk. The area is quite in the evenings though with the cafe's, bar,s and shops closing quite early. Monica, the owner and her family and staff could not have done enough for us. Booking local places to eat, giving good tourist info, train times/local bus info so we could explore the wider regions of Florence and Tuscany on our own without a set tour(don,t miss Lucca and Fiesole), and will book you museum tickets to avoid the queue,s . Although we would definately recommend the Chianti/Sienna tour. Really good value, visiting a beautiful vineyard in the heart of the Tuscan hills, with lunch, wine tasting and a whole lot more. The trip starting at 9.30 a,m and not returning to Florence until 8p.m. Fantastic day.  Our room was lovely and spacious with french doors that opened up onto the square. The bathroom although not big was nicely laid out and just like the rest of the hotel was very clean and beautifully decorated. Breakfast.s were delicious. Cold buffet type, but everything you could think of was there.It was a special trip for us and the thought and care that Monica and her staff had gone to the trouble of to make our stay so lovely was fantastic. Having said that, i think even if it hadn,t been a special celebration, the attention to detail from them all would have been the same. They are all definately in the right business for them. Go yourselves and see!!If you get the airport shuttle to the bus station( which runs about every half hour) the drop off point is where you get the local bus to the hotel, no;s 31 and 32 but buy your tickets first from the little booth in the middle of the pedestrian crossing island.
Reviews.Author: daisyWarwickshire

Reviews.Content: Best B  Couldnt fault this small delightful hotel. The staff couldnt help enough and the room was large and beautifully decorated. They have a tiny breakfast room which was cute and a lovely restaurant next door if you need a rest from city walking! The hotel is a little outside the City over the river Arno. It really is no problem and the bus stops virtually outside the hotel and a very pleasant ride of 20 mins into the main historic district. The hotel have bus tickets too. Would highly recommend this hotel and it was actually pleasant to come away from the centre after walking all day and resting in the small tree plazza outside the hotel in the evening.
Reviews.Author: WorcestershireSally

Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel Rosary Garden The Hotel Rosary Garden is a splendid, small hotel conveniently located in the south of Florence, that is run with the very essence of hospitality by Monica, who speaks English fluently, and is a gracious and very helpful host. The rooms are quaintly beautiful, spotlessly clean, with comfortable bedding,and many small amenities. Conveniently located near the best gelato I ever had, and a wonderful place to get provisions (ask Monica). I can think of no reason to look for anywhere else to stay when visiting Florence.
Reviews.Author: kazchaz

Reviews.Content: They don't come any better than this This is one of the best small, boutique hotels I have ever experienced. The staff is delightful - friendly and truly service minded. The rooms are ample in size and very clean and bright. The hotel has a cheerful and charming exterior and interior. This hotel is tops - they simply do not come any better.
Reviews.Author: cjburger742

Reviews.Content: brilliant choice We have just returned from a five day trip to Florence staying at the Hotel Rosary Garden.This hotel was picked based on reviews on trip advisor. I was so pleased that I made this choice. The hotel lived up to all of our expectations. Large clean room (we had booked a superior room), friendly helpful staff, they could not have done more for us. The hotel is a 10 minute bus ride from the centre of Florence, but the buses are easy, cheap and frequent and enable you to see more of the city and get a feel of the place. We ate at a couple of local restaurants and a theatre restaurant in the centre of Florence all recommended by Monica, they were spot on. We flew to Pisa and then a coach to Florence, again service excellent and very easy. I would recommend this hotel to anybody, it was great and made our stay a truly memorable one.
Reviews.Author: metson

Reviews.Content: Will make your Florence trip simply SPECTACULAR!!!! My husband and I stayed here for 4 days in mid-September for our honeymoon/anniversary. As attorneys living in NYC, we've had to stay at many hotels which mostly have been wonderful, but we CANNOT say enough about Rosary Garden! It was hands down the best hotel experience that either of us have ever had. There's a reason this hotel jumped roughly 500 spots to the #4 hotel in Florence since new management took over.From the moment we pulled up, the staff made us feel as welcome as our own families do. Our hotel room was incredibly big by European standards, and also was beautifully decorated and very clean. The rest of the hotel is equally beautiful with a comfy apperitivi room and lobby. We just can't believe the rates are as reasonable as they are!But the best aspect of the experience was the staff. Alessandro, Monica, and Monica's son Andrea were simply the best. They had put the most delicious champagne in our room because we told them it was our anniversary. Every time we had a question, needed a bus ticket, or wanted a restaurant recommendation, they were there with the most helpful advice. I also lost my purse (which contained my wallet, passports, camera, iPod, etc.) in a cab and Alessandro made phone calls to the cab companies, the police, the US consulate, etc. He was so genuinely concerned about me getting my belongings back and eventually the hotel did get them back for me! (Would never happen in NYC!).Monica sat with us one night during apperitivis, and she is just too sweet for words. We couldn't believe that she was taking time out to speak with us when she had this busy hotel to run!Admittedly, we were slightly reluctant to stay here because the hotel is on the other side of the Arno River, not in Florence's city center. But this turned out to be just another asset of the hotel! We walked back to the hotel from the city a couple of times during our stay and it allowed us to see another part of Florence, one that most tourists would never see otherwise! So please do not let its location keep you from staying. Additionally, right downstairs from the hotel is a restaurant where we had one of our best meals in all of Italy, and a gelato place with the most delicious (and cheapest) gelato we found in Italy. Thank you Rosary Garden, Alessandro, Monica, Andrea, and everyone else who made our stay so wonderful. We surely will be back!
Reviews.Author: SulfacetR

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay in Florence We stayed at the Rosary Gardens for one night last week. We had been staying in Viareggio but wanted to visit Florence and booked the Rosary Gardens before leaving the UK.The manager / owner is a very nice lady who is more than wiling to assist with your enquiries, and the staff are very nice. The hotel itself is very nice....cosy, warm and inviting. The room we stayed in (21) was large with a good bed and all the possible amenities. The hotel is a good walk away from the main town (20 minutes), but you can always take a taxi if you don't want to walk.All in all, a nice hotel that I would recommend.
Reviews.Author: TripTraveller2007

Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel       Floence
Reviews.Author: lawyefwb

Reviews.Content: Classy little hotel in Florence I found out about this hotel through a friend and decided to book and spend almost a week in one of my favorite cities in the world: Florence.Like most reviews say, the hotel is not in the very center of Florence but believe me it is not a problem to take a walk and enjoy the atmosphere of the city.The hotel itself if very classy and perfect for staying alone or with your partner. The breakfast and the service are EXCELLENT!
Reviews.Author: SebastianReinhardt

Reviews.Content: Very cozy little hotel       the hotel
Reviews.Author: miltonmarchi

Reviews.Content: Truly one of nicest places to stay in Italy The Hotel Rosary Garden is a true gem! My wife and I spent three wonderful nights there in the Spring (2008), and it was absolutely perfect. Located outside the noise and crowds of downtown Florence, the Hotel Rosary Garden (HSG) is well-situated in a quiet little neighborhood a little beyond the Bardini Gardens. One of the best gelato shops in all of Italy is right next door (and we tried many, many others). Nearby, within short five-minute walking distance, are several excellent restaurants. The hotel itself is everything you could ask for and more. Our room, a superior double, had HUGE vaulted ceilings with exposed wood beams, a comfy sofa, a sizeable bathroom (for Italy), and many other niceties. The breakfasts, included in the price of the room, are served in a cozy little room and are quite tasty. There were also several rooms in the HSG set aside simply for relaxing, with free danish cookies, tea, and digestivos (liqueurs). In a word, wonderful.But the very best part of HSG is the owner, Monica. Although the staff is excellent, Monica is unparalleled as a host, concierge, and friend to her guests. She is what an Italian host (or any host) should be. I could honestly go on for paragraphs about the HSG. Given the terrific value that it offers, I would rank this hotel among the best in Italy; It offers the ease, comfort, and beauty of a five-star hotel without the snootiness and the attitude. If you are in Florence and they have room, stay at the Hotel Rosary Garden. You will be very, very glad that you did. Note: If you are wondering how to get there from the train station (as we were), please email the hotel staff first as a bus goes directly from the station to the square where the HSG resides. It is about a 15 minute ride and very, very easy.
Reviews.Author: MBWD

Reviews.Content: Best Hotel in Florence We stayed at Hotel Rosary Gardens in June for 2 nights. Absolutely Fantastic! The owner is a lovely young Italian lady called Monica and she made us feel so comfortable from the minute we stepped in to the hotel. Our room was very well appointed and incredibly clean and spacious! Bathroom was just perfect and spotless.There is a smart communal sitting area where little aperitifs are offered free of charge. The reception staff were incredibly helpful and courteous - nothing was an effort.Hotel is about 20 mins leisurely walk to Central Florence and you can get cabs if you wish to..,I would not stay anywhere else in Florence.. try it for yourselves...
Reviews.Author: DKLONDONUK

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Small Hotel and Lovely Staff The very good Trip Advisor Reviews are spot on for this lovely , very clean and comfortable small hotel.The staff are always smiling and very helpful and nothing is too much trouble.It is not within our walking distance from the Centre of Florence however the location is easily reached by bus. The best ice cream we had in Italy is sold just around the corner from the hotel.
Reviews.Author: alexa21

Reviews.Content: Good find Stayed 5 nights at the Rosary Garden. It is a charming, small hotel with an excellent staff. We had the room you see pictured on Trip Advisor and it was lovely. As for location it is NOT a 10 minute walk to the historic part of Florence, but rather a 15-20 minutes bus ride. The bus stop is about 100 feet from the hotel and runs about every 10 minutes. Although we had no problems using the bus, after a long day of sightseeing you don't always feel like taking it back into town for dinner. The hotel has only a breakfast room (good buffet) and there is only one restaurant in close proximity open for dinner. However, comparing prices to what you pay in town for hotels this is still a very good deal.
Reviews.Author: Girlgolfpro

Reviews.Content: Nicest room we had on our vacation I booked this hotel without looking at the location based on the high ratings on Trip Advisor. I started to cancel when I saw the location, but the reviews were so good we decided to stay. I'm glad we did. It was the nicest hotel room we had on our entire trip, including one of the Hiltons in Paris.I'm very glad for the people who had no trouble taking a bus to the hotel. We took a cab, and I think the cost with luggage was 15 Euros. It was very, very quick and easy to take a bus into town each day and the kind and gracious hotel staff told us exactly which buses would take us where. We had our choice of several buses which ran frequently and could buy a discount pass at the newspaper stand in front of the hotel. There was one stop right in front of the hotel, and another behind the Coop groc;ery store. Getting a bus back was not so easy as there was absolutely no way we could figure out which direction the buses were going, so we took cabs back to the hotel at a cost of about 10 Euros.There was a restaurant underneath the hotel, La Pizzatta that was quite good. We went in at about 8:30 and were asked if we had a reservation and I rolled my eyes because the place was empty. By the time we finished it was packed. Prices were very reasonable except for the steaks, which come from some type of special cows and cost 60 euros. At those prices I hope they can sing and dance!About a quarter-mile down the main street towards Florence was a cheap sit-down pizza place and a good gelato parlor (the pizza place is across the street from the gelato parlor, not the first place you come to). We enjoyed both.It was also nice to have the Coop grocery across the street. This is a giant store -- they even have an electronics department. I was able to buy bread, meat, cheese, fruit, soft drinks and a tube of mayonaise to make a meal on the train to Rome and another after we got there. It was a real and much needed cost savings.Check-in for this hotel is on the second floor, so if you have mobility problems it won't do. For anyone else, the quality of the hotel should more than make up for the location, but of course that is a decision each person will have to make for themselves. If this hotel were in central Florence it would be the one of the highest priced luxury hotels because of the room quality. It's not, so you get a luxury room at a relatively reasonable price.
Reviews.Author: Crack-O-Noon

Reviews.Content: Charming, but inconvenient Rosary Garden Hotel is a lovely hotel with a very friendly staff across the Arno River in the suburbs of Florence. LOCATION: If you arrive by train, as my daughter and I did, you can reach the Rosary Garden Hotel by taking bus 32 or 33. Be sure to get off the bus at the COOP Grocery store, just across the river and on your left if facing the driver of the bus. The hotel is diagonally across the square (park) from the bus stop. We were unsure where to get off, and ended up riding to the end of the route. We were helped by a lovely woman who spoke some English (certainly more than the spot of Italian we knew).CHECK-IN: The hotel lobby is on the second floor (or, first floor for Europeans) and up a steep set of stairs. If you have any issues with stairs, or carrying your suitcase(s) up a flight or two of stairs, you may not want to stay here. The hotel staff is absolutely delightful! They go out of their way to ensure that you have a wonderful stay in Florence. In fact, every native to Florence who we encountered, were genuinely kind and eager to help.ROOM: Charming decor, and clean. The double had two twin beds, side-by-side. The bathroom was large enough, and spotless.BREAKFAST: Nice selection of breads, pastries, cheese, meat, yogurt and cereal. The coffee, of course, was heavenly.
Reviews.Author: euorpaphile

Reviews.Content: Pleasant Hotel       Drawing-room
Reviews.Author: Elena_A_I

Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel This was our first time in Italy and I had read great reviews about this hotel. Mainly from Trip Advisor. It was all it was said to have been. This hotel, although small, is cozy and pleasant. The staff were always greeting us by our names and letting us know all the ins and outs of Florence life. The room was nicely decorated and a nice size. Shower was a bit small, but everything else was great. Their Tea Room with complimentary wines and drinks was nice. Breakfast every morning was very tasty and the waitstaff were alway willing to get you another cappacino. Great stay and would totally recommend this hotel to anyone. Easily accessable via the bus. If the bus driver doesnt know the Bus stop by name (il Bandino) just get off at the COOP grocery store which is across the street...
Reviews.Author: raautilio

Reviews.Content: wonderful little hotel We had three really nice nights here. The welcome and service was personal, friendly and helpful and the decor beautiful. The suburban location is quiet yet easy to find ( 1 euro bus fare from city centre). There is a good restaurant next door where you eat with Italians not other tourists. A real find and thoroughly recommended.
Reviews.Author: makabusi

Reviews.Content: Spectacular       Our room
Reviews.Author: DrSavant

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Cozy Retreat in Florence My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon in Italy, and we found this hotel to be just wonderful! It is extremely clean and tastefully decorated. The lovely aperitifs and comfortable chairs/internet access made for a cozy, warm feel upon returning from a full day in Florence. We also loved that this hotel was in a real neighborhood, away from the tourist areas. The hotel is a nice walk along the Arno River to the city center, or a very easy trip on the 31 or 32 bus (stops in front of hotel) to all the central points in Florence. It is an excellent value! We would definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: julia44

Reviews.Content: Really comfortable Hotel We stayed for three nights in the Rosary Garden in September this year and really loved it. The rooms are beautifully furnished with sofas, plenty of wardrobe space and huge beds. Bathrooms excellent and all very clean. Monica , the owner, could not be more pleasant and helpful. She will do everything she can to make your stay enjoyable.  The hotel is on a small square with a bus stop 30 seconds from the front door and the ride to the centre of Florence takes 10 minutes . If you stay there be sure to visit the icecream parlour right behind the hotel , it is fantastic!!! The restaurant next door is good and the staff are very friendly.By the way if you are travelling on a crowded bus and see a man with his jacket casually draped over one shoulder he is not trying to look cool. He is a pickpocket and has partner who will try to distract you. Luckily I realised what was happening and moved away.
Reviews.Author: CnI

Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and helpful staff After a disappointing stay in Siena we were greeted with fresh start at a wonderful 3 star hotel with the attitude of 5. Our hotel room was open and inviting with 1.5 story Tuscan vaulted ceiling with a charming decor. The hotel bathroom was very clean and modern. The staff helped us map out sites, restaurants and travel arrangements by taxi, bus and train. The hotel staff arranged museum reservations and provided the purchase of bus tickets which saved us time. The hotel tipped us off on the local favorite for gelato and a gastronomia that has wonderful choices of local cuisine. Our local friend later told us that the gelato place is one of two of the favorites in Florence. We met other travelers from other countries during breakfast time and had a great conversation even though we did not speak French (one of the staff members assisted in the translation). Breakfast was enjoyable with my morning espresso, croissant and nutella. While my wife enjoyed the tea room, I enjoyed the Vin Santo wine and biscotti. I forgot to mention that this hotel was recommended by our friend that has had relatives and friends stay there in the past. This hotel and staff exceeded our expecations. We plan to stay there again in the future.
Reviews.Author: rcklein

Reviews.Content: Loved Rosary Garden Hotel We stayed at the Rosary Garden Hotel for 3 nights in July of this year (2007) and have only just been home a week after 7 weeks travelling. It was far and away the most welcoming of all the places we stayed (Ireland, London, Paris, Italy) in the entire time we were away. Monica, the owner , was gracious and charming and nothing was a bother. I watched her spend at least 10 minutes with a guest in order to ensure that he knew exactly where he was travelling to whilst at the same time she ensured that another staff member attended to my needs. The little extra touches (bowls of sweets, apperitifs in the charming little sitting room, dainty biscuits available with coffee/tea -also in the little sitting room) were superb. It was such a comfortable hotel - the breakfast was delightful and we found that the short bus ride into the city centre was another way of meeting the locals. (The same gentleman helped me validate my bus ticket two days in a row much to the delight of the fellow passengers!). If we were coming back to Florence my only object would be to ensure that Monica was still in charge - I have no doubt that it is her finger on the pulse that ensured our stay was so pleasant.
Reviews.Author: zorroSydney

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, unusual location We stayed at the Rosary Garden over Easter and really liked this small, comfortable, quiet hotel. It is, however, quite a long way from the centre of Florence - fine when the buses are working (as several routes from Santa Maria Novella stop just across the street), but a 30 minute walk to the Ponte Vecchio when they weren't, as over a public holiday.
Reviews.Author: MsVacationLondon

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Rooms This is a wonderful hotel. It is quaint and cozy, our room was big and decorated beautifully and had two showers. The owner was very nice and made sure we were happy with our room, which we were very happy with it. We had a wonderful night's sleep at the Hotel Rosary Garden, thanks to the Holiday Inn for being full. Our room was called the Bourbon Queen, great for a family.  Have fun in Firenze, The Geraci Family
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Quelle bonne critique   showReview(16358077, 'full');
Reviews.Author: francophonequebec

Reviews.Content: Hotel id茅al pour visiter...   showReview(16726589, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Splendido soggiorno   showReview(8038109, 'full');
Reviews.Author: gatamo

Reviews.Content: Hotel tr猫s tranquille avec un...   showReview(11337831, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
